Unanswered1. If a Muslim male marries a Christian girl in the presence of 2 non-Muslim
witnesses, the Nikah will be correct. (Shaami vol.3 pg.23; HM Sa'eed).
However, due to possible problems in the future, both, Nikah to a Christian
female as well as witness of non-Muslims should be avoided.
2. According to historical narration, Hadhrat Hasan (Radhiallaahu Anhu)
married 90 women. (Taarikhul Khulafaa). If that is correct, then obviously
Hadhrat Hasan (Radhiallaahu Anhu) must have had a maximum of 4 wives at
once.
